Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friends pork ribs and chopped brisket

GCDgyOHpitH9N9waGlh-bg.text: This is the second time we've ordered food to go from Rollin' Smoke. The first time, the meat was hot and tasted good but the amount of pepper they used was overwhelming. We had forgotten about their obsession with over-peppering and ordered again tonight. This time it was practically inedible. Don't get me wrong, I like pepper. I like spice. I like peppered, spiced BBQ, but this was out of control. The green beans were doused in pepper, and so was the brisket. The sauce even has big hunks of pepper in it. Aside from the fact that it was way over-peppered, the brisket was floating on top of a 1/4-inch thick layer of grease. Six paper towels couldn't soak it all up so that we could eat it. I finally just gave up.   It is unfortunate that the meat really does taste good but the pepper and grease just make it inedible.

wHqtJqdmQhc1cksqY9Qa1A.text: It's my first time here. Their food is really good. I got the Pit Special with 5 meats and 3 sides. It was really good. The meat is nice and tender, not overly smoked in. They have a good selection of sauces. My favorites are the Carolina vinegar and Mama sweet. As far as the sides, I as only able to try 3: Dirty Rice, Cheesy Mac 'N Cheese a d Collsrd Greens. I only liked the collared greens. I didn't care much for the other 2. I'd definitely come back.

kOShGVf2QPUruVMr_A_1GQ.text: I have ordered from this location no fewer than five times during the past two months and the food quality has been exemplary each and every time. My family has troublesome dietary needs and Rollin Smoke is careful to accommodate each and every time--this is appreciated more than can be stated because hangry, stomach-achy women are not pleasant to be around. It's a bit more expensive than what we might normally eat but:  1) you get what you pay for 2) food safety/reliability is a huge concern for us and they have never let us down 3) it's a nice splurge for our family at the end of a long work week.  Overall, this is our #1 favorite go-to restaurant for delicious take-out barbecue for when no one in the house knows what the heck they want to eat. The brisket and chicken wings with the vinegar sauce is to die for.

HL8boTn6BGzFS1XNqrdv1g.text: Food comes out very quick and the pulled pork and mac n cheese are the best! I was not impressed with the peach cobbler which was disappointing but I'm so happy we went, it was so worth it! Such good BBQ!

ARmZxw0E8wt5iSZT3mXqFA.text: First time ordering food here and used online ordering.  As expected, I received e:mails confirming the order and another saying that it would be ready for pick-up at a specific time.  However, when arriving, I was told that there was a glitch in their system and that the order was not processed.  The staff apologized and stated that they would have it ready in 10 minutes.  Would have been nice if they has offered water, soda, or a complimentary side dish for the inconvenience. In addition, I had ordered baked beans, which they were not out of.  Had it not been for this, I would gladly give it 5 stars.  On a positive note, the food is delicious.  We had sliced brisket, baby back ribs, along with a variety of side dishes.  We live close and will definitely return to Rollin' Smoke.

lUqCOcbpJh4cwyDW1vON-w.text: Nary is Awesome and the food is the best!  I make it to town about once a month and make sure I stop in to Rollin' Smoke for dinner at least one night!  Best BBQ in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big menu!
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D8QgtSZJ6NdlJ3BaixSUZw.text: Awesome service, great tasting bbq, my first time here today and definitely will be back with friends

fRnVtag-jGqkaNHah0ozfw.text: Personally I'm not really into knocking businesses or being a rude customer, but key word here is customer. I order over 70.00 dollars worth of food for 3 to 4 people. When pick up time came I was given two bags.   In those bags were no napkins, forks, plates, and I had to pay extra for sauces. I don't mind paying extra, but I will say this Famous Daves gives plenty of food, napkins, paper plates, and plastic forks without charging.   When I got home I saw that the food was alright and honestly smaller portions compared to there competitor. The food was good I won't say anything negative there, but portion wise I don't find it and paying extra for any sauce was a joke.   Maybe in the future I might return, but I don't think I would due to the lack of service. Even when I arrived I was given one box lol and I was like that doesn't look like 70 bucks worth of food, so another girl had to show her the orders and locate mine lol. That to me was no biggie, but still service wise could've been better. This was my second time ordering from them, I believe in going twice just to make a review.   Overall I would say the food is alright, but again Famous Daves without a doubt has more food and better prices for the same things I bought.

3KK_2KTl-fJRRpVPNWszzA.text: Great experience overall.  The staff was super friendly and knowledgeable about the menu.  They know exactly what is gluten free. I had sliced brisket and pulled pork with bacon potato salad, which was so delish! The bf had the meatloaf, he said it was great, and it was huge.  Nice bbq atmosphere. A definite return spot

YTqVp6IBqUl6VbioVTP3ig.text: This place is GREAT. Right from the start, the staff was super friendly, joking and having fun with us like we were old friends. And the food is so effing good. I love my meats, and this place was heaven. I'm writing this as I slip in and out of a food coma. I shared the pit special, a 5 meat sampler plate, with my beau. There was so much food we had to pack a box for the leftovers. I didn't save room for the banana pudding!  I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pit special. You&#39;re gonna need a hungry friend to share it with.

n0dM11kafLlDmfEabu9yUw.text: Poor service. Placed order online and went into store to pick up. Upon arrival I gave the cashier my name and she replies in annoyance that "we don't have an order for that name" and then turns her back to me and walks away. I was confused as to her expectation at this point. I guess she just wanted me to go away. When she decides to pay attention to me again, I pull up the email to show her my order confirmation and she rolls her eyes and hands me a bag of food and walks away again. So I guess she did have an order with that name after all. No sauces included and I felt like she might have a complete meltdown if I asked her for BBQ sauce. I would also like to add that I was the only person in line at this point so it's not like she was overwhelmed with customers. I ordered and payed online (tipped - but clearly that was a mistake) so it's difficult to understand how this place delivers poor service when all they have to do is hand someone their food and maybe say "thanks"   The food was ok but without any sauce it was not what I wanted. Hoped to enjoy some BBQ and instead felt like I wasted $30.

ZLS9gy3WgfNS9KUEole_pg.text: Cozy country atmosphere with great smoky smell. The food is delicious. Tons of variety in country dishes and several bbq sauce types. We ordered the duo with pork and brisket, pork sandwich with mac 'n' cheese, and brisket sliders with green beans.  The meat was phenomenal and the portion size for the duo was quite large. The sandwich and sliders on the other hand were very small portions. This was surprising, especially considering the price, which is why this place gets 4 stars instead of 5. Be warned, the brisket and mac 'n' cheese is very peppery, so avoid those if you're not a fan of black pepper (my wife hates it). I loved both, and the garlic green beans as well. I'll go back when I'm in the area.

dWxoa_JXxEfi7YQmqnLW0w.text: Ordered a whole rack of beef ribs and a pint of loaded mashed potatoes.  Questioned how many pieces in an order of cornbread - was told 2 pieces.  Added 1 order.  To go total came to $57!!!  The worker ended up charging me a pint's order of cornbread instead of the single order, so I got 4 pieces instead of 2.  Really didn't want 4, but the charge was already done so I just decided to keep it as is.  Ribs were not as big as remembered from the original location, nor were they fall off the bone like the ones at the original location.  Loaded mash was not that great and I definitely didn't feel like my $57 was well spent here... This place sucked - period.

LxaDc4sJO7zZvNfEDhipeQ.text: It is crap compared to John Mull's or Lucille's over price and I can do better with a baby  Weber

F0EalOnOZRFcvfuqGSz-gw.text: Lunch with my sister, kiddo & niece. The atmosphere is fun! Didn't care for the metal chairs, but that's a personal thing. It's a little cramped in the dining room, but man oh man, they thought of everything in set up! There is the house BBQ sauce available on every table & then a variety of different sauces at The condiments station! They had lids for the sides and flatware for to go orders as well! They even have a Kureg! We ordered 2 duo combo and a piggy sandwich. Sissy had brisket & ribs with bacon potato salad. That ish is the bomb! Perfectly cooked potatoes, creamy, just enough mayo & the BACON!  I had the chicken & ribs with Mac n cheese. Chicken was cooked well. Super tender. Ribs were delicious. The Mac n cheese is shell pasta, so my kiddo went nuts for it! She had the piggy sandwich and she loved it. The pulled pork is so tender it literally melts in your mouth. I did find the sauce to be a little too spicy for me, but I am a wuss with spice, so if you like spicy you'll love it! A bit on the pricy side, but definitely worth a trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Duo combo - chicken &amp; ribs with Mac &amp; Cheese!

vMuJxGGRFaNiUdDXtBpnlQ.text: Ordered carry out through Grubhub, they forgot my coleslaw but the food was so good that we didn't find it to be a major issue. The brisket three ways is great. Rib tips are quite fatty but the chopped brisket is so good. I ordered it with sauce on the side(not sure if that's how it's normally served) it needed very little sauce since it was so flavorful its own. The crunchy bits make it. We really had low expectations for the wings but those turned out to be some of the best wings I've had. The skin was crispy, a little dry but that's how I like them. Lemon pepper rub was flavorful and didn't leave the wings tasting like they were covered in a dry rub. Cannot comment on the sides as we did not have any. We will definitely be back.

xufkTdp2n3LKX2BZQn17WQ.text: The sides are excellent! Great service , cute atmosphere chicken was very juicy. We ordered the 5 meat pit special for lunch. Great price for two people and plenty left over to take home. Honestly I would go back just for the chicken and sides ! So good.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 5 meat special. So good !

Baq6yQ4O--EW2ZTmz7FlAw.text: I've gotten takeout food from this location 3 times now. In general, I'd say it delicious!! There have been a few issues such as mistakes on our order 2 of the 3 times and burnt dry ribs on the last visit.  Regardless, I think it's pretty spectacular BBQ. The chopped brisket is tender and flavorful. It doesn't require any sauce. Their sauce is on the peppery side. The greens are to die for and the corn nuggets are divine. The cornbread is delicious too but two small squares are $3.50. I think we've agreed that ordering the meat by the pound with the pint sides will feed a crowd for about $12 a person. Honestly, I've never even been inside.  I think it's a bit pricey but very tasty and I will certainly order again!

8Xjrdmeb6wdJ7wNFWwxe8g.text: Best barbecue I have found in Vegas. We moved from Kansas City and this would Do well in that city.   Corn nuggets and okra are awesome sides.  Love the brisket.   Smoked meat loaf was awesome.  The baked potato stuffed with pulled pork was awesome for lunch.    Have not tried any desserts yet but heard lots of good reviews on the banana pudding.   Not a ton of seats so take out is a good option

xn6qzVJ4jHR_-jJ0FlpEaA.text: I love this place! We were at the downtown and now at the Summerlin location. The ribs, St Louis, Baby Back and the rib tips were excellent. 3kMDrZj2veMkCCHBu183sg.text: Had delivery about a week ago. Just now having time to do review. Food was dry. Best part was sauce. Pretty disappointed this time. Spent almost $40. We've ate here before and food was good. Not happy this time around.

P2Iu5k5R777F-FjMjWEtCA.text: The food was fantastic! However, I have to say the staff madame feel welcome. They gave me a sample of Chipotle Cole Slaw and something to drink. They were awesome!!!

EOa4l1YGMuUtCCSN5o-o8g.text: I'm so upset I spent $102 for some mediocre warmed up food. We got one rack of baby back ribs. Barely any meat, dry and did fall off the bone. The only good thing was that there enough for 3 people. Ordered the shrimp platter and that was $16.99 for 8 pieces of shrimp and 3 pieces on hush puppies that were the size of the gum from the gym all machine. Since they were known for their meatloaf - I ordered that. The mashed potatoes that came with the meatloaf tasted sour as if it was sitting out and went bad or if they used old milk/sour cream. We also got two kids meal for $9.99 each for some prepackaged burger patties. Mac N Cheese was not cheesy at all. It was just a bunch of over cooked smushed pasta with lots of black pepper and sprinkle cheese on top.   Don't waste your time and money, just go straight to Lucille's.

VjjZ5_SpBZ-Drh8ag_jw8Q.text: Eaten at Grand Canyon location 4 times. inconsistent food Taste and very "pricey" for what you get...Everything ala-carte unle$$ you "combo it" Many xlint BBQ places in town at far better portions & prices. 2 sandwiches, drink & modest tip $40.00.......Come-on?

ViX-2nEdReX_qZ-j3l1UVw.text: This was our first time here and THE FOOD WAS PHENOMENAL!!!!! We had the Pit Special (5 meats, 3 sides) rolls and cornbread. The meat was seasoned well and had a separate distinct flavor for each. We had the green beans , dirty rice, and fried okra. So delicious. o6emZyixaqL0SpOYpL3RiQ.text: Hands down best BBQ in Vegas! Prices are a tad high but the portions make up for it...

VeU4ZYanBHB7Sbsm7rlBkw.text: Totally legit Texas-style BBQ!  Perfectly done brisket, great pulled pork and the baby backs were outstanding!  Next visit I want to try the smoked meatloaf... looks great!  Beans had just enough bite to offset The sweetness, corn nuggets were great and they have SIX kinds of housemade BBQ sauces.  Wonderful cornbread as well... at the end of my lunch they brought me some complimentary banana pudding!  BONUS: The owners were just as nice & gracious as could be... made you feel like a guest in their home.  Can't wait to come back next time I'm in town.

0dXNNYj3QwdJ3g7HMrWzMA.text: Let me first say that BBQ is a varied and wondrous thing.  There are as many different versions and variants as there are pit masters and pigs. Some folks like it spicy while others prefer it sweet.  Some like it soaked in sauce and others like it dry.  Some like it heavily smoked while other folks prefer just hints of wood. There really is no single requirement or standard.  This is why running a BBQ joint can be a tough gig. You know you're just not going to be able to make it great - for everybody.  At its core however, BBQ is ultimately a choreography of wood, fire, and meat that, when properly executed, is a thing of beauty.  To do this at home is one thing, but to do it in a restaurant-based production line is something completely different. It is a business and an art many fail at.   I had heard so much about RS over the years I was very excited to find their new facility in Summerlin.  As a Las Vegas local, I try to avoid the Strip unless all other dining options (including the neighbor's cat) have been exhausted.  Okay...that was a joke...I love cats... and I would have to catch it.  Anyway, when the new RS opened near me, I made it a point to drop by.  With almost 2000 four and five star reviews, I went with very high  expectations - maybe too high.   I ordered two of their five meat plates to go. Each plate came with three small sides, so I upgraded them to larges and figured I would have ample food to feed six. The service was courteous and fast, so when I headed out the door with two heavy bags in tow I was giddy about the impending feast.  That story changed somewhat when I got home and uncrated the grub.   The first thing that struck us was the size (or lack thereof) of the side portions.  We opened up the large side containers to find them only 3/4 (or less) full.  When we opened up the cornbread boxes (I purchased 3 orders) we were also disappointed to find 6 tiny (I mean tiny) squares. I remember my wife joking that they had clearly mixed up their cornbread with their croutons.  By the time the sides were distributed we each had about a tablespoon or two of each one.   RANT FOLLOWS: C'mon guys - you're not on The Strip feeding a bunch of hungover tourists who will never return.  You are in Summerlin  feeding your hard working fellow locals - and we want a manly piece of cornbread and grown up side servings!  I paid over 80 bucks for my order and, for that price, I should be granted a full container of beans!! We are your desert brothers and sisters...we come to you because we are hungry...feed us! Okay, I feel better... sorry.   Unlike the sides, the meat portions were ample. The chicken was outstanding.  It was juicy, perfectly cooked, and fall off the bone tender. Great bird guys!  The hot links were tasty as well, as were the ribs.  I wouldn't change a thing on either.   The brisket and pork, however, were disappointing to say the least. The brisket we received was so chewy it required a sharp knife (a brisket no no), and the pork was something else entirely.  I have had pulled pork, chopped pork, chunked pork, pork loin, pork butt, and pork chops but what we received was a pile of what can best be described as "pork hash."  It was almost minced.  When I tasted it, it became clear why they had done this. It was full of fat.  That also explained the oozing pool of grease it floated on.  It had a great flavor though - I can't wait to go back and try the actual meat.   Finally, on a positive note, the sauces were a home run.  Our favorites were the mustard and vinegar selections. Just like back home, and even a bit better.  You could pour this stuff on a rock and make it edible.  Great sauces guys! Best I have had in town - by far.   Bottom line here is that RS makes some tasty stuff; tasty enough to bring us back for a second try in a month or two.  In the meantime, my hope is that they get their heads off "The Strip" and start feeding their fellow desert brethren like we deserve.  I will even give them a pass on the brisket and greasy fatty pork, because their sauce is so good it even made them edible.  And the collard greens....did I mention the collard greens? Pure Southern  perfection.

rcYQa-gSjeDc18yYFkcSdA.text: I heard good reviews and remember I was watching something and it mention this place so I decided to go one day. Went w my friend, we both were not impressed. Over priced and it did not come out hot. The cashier didn't tell us about our local discount until after we paid. I wouldn't come back.

laWB55T04uXSUmhj58umGw.text: I came to Rollin' Smoke BBQ on a Sunday afternoon it was relatively slow but the service was excellent. Q_vbVYqWimcVfrZ4CZbhTA.text: If you hungry then go Rollin smoke. Rib platter with a extra beef rib is the one! Smoked chicken, links and rib tips is another one u can't go wrong. Order the corn nuggets and potato salad, you thank me later

nvKj3J_tp5QEQhSzIIXtLw.text: I will start with the positives.  The staff is friendly, the service is very good.  The restaurant is clean.  It hasn't changed much since it was Billy's BBQ before.  I got a 1/2 pound of brisket.  The brisket was tender and seasoned well.  But here are the negatives.  I grew up on Texas BBQ and one Cardinal Sin is that you DO NOT sauce the brisket.  Sauce is served on the side and optional for those who want it.  While the sauce was just drizzled on the meat, it still was wrong.  And the sauce they served on the side was not good at all.  I tossed it and used my own sauce at the house.  I also wanted potato salad, but they make it with onions, which I still have problems comprehending why people would do this?!  All you can taste is the onions, and not the potatoes!   I'm glad I asked though, because I was informed that they garnish the brisket with chives, too?!  What the... ?!   Most of my favorite places in Texas have plenty of onions, pickles and peppers for those who want to add that to your meal, there is no need to take anything away from the meat, if your meat is good... and theirs is!   Since the potato salad had onions, I opted for the mac & cheese.  It was ok.  Didn't have much flavor and it looked like it had big pepper flakes scattered in it.  It's nothing I would get again.  I would definitely get the brisket here again, but tell them no sauce or chives next time.  It, along with the staff, service and cleanliness is why I'm giving it three stars.

CjfwloJNySopnN3j_kjriw.text: The barbeque here is simply spectacular!  The sauce is perfectly blended not to spicy and just enough flavor.  The chicken was a little on the dry side but still flavorful.  If you're ever in Vegas it is a must stop if you are in the mood for some really good barbeque!  Come early as they close early around 10PM on Friday and Saturday and by Vegas standards that is real early!

fvaAerpW3wnwUpqtxKVl-g.text: Not all that.  Fresh, quality meats and quick service. Sides are non descript...but the corn things were special.   Its not bad, but I dont get what all the hype is about. $25, after a $5 off coupon for 'meh.'

f9uNkQ84LvnEsenRsnVe9Q.text: Small place in the corner of a shopping center with a big menu , there are a lot of things on the board to read but the helpful and super friendly staff will guide you with whatever questions you have . I-To3iE2FKsd_dEINnarrw.text: I can seriously make this the shortest review ever and just put a drooling face emoji because that's how I felt after the first taste. We were a few doors down when the smell drew us in like Toucan Sam followed Fruit Loops. Ok, so first thing we notice when looking at the menu of course was the prices next to each item, they seemed a little high. (I'll justify the price in a minute, I promise!) Everything sounded so good though and the pictures of some of the items looked delicious. We placed our orders with who I believe was the owner, he was very nice, made us feel welcomed and described the menu in detail to help us make a decision. My 2 boys shared the 2 sliders kid's meal with mac n cheese, it was more than enough for 2 kids to share. Of course I had to try their Mac n' cheese which was delicious. My husband had "The Biggin" with the fried corn nuggets. I had the limited time fried chicken and hot link with a side of loaded mashed potatoes and gravy. Now for the taste! This is where the prices went completely insignificant at this point and I would've paid $100 for a sandwich! I took a scoop of mashed potatoes, dipped it in the gravy and I swear I blacked out for a quick second. They melted in my mouth before I even had a chance to get a second spoonful. I ended up eating the remaining gravy with a spoon just like soup, it was that good! The crispy fried chicken skin had a hint of dry rub in the buttermilk. The kids ate every last bit of their pulled pork and brisket sliders. My husband loved his sandwich and the corn nuggets were sweet and creamy on the inside while crispy on the outside. We are so coming back!!

beG_k-xeWTKD1o5D9NO2jA.text: This place is amazing !! "Big" Mike is awesome he is so knowledgeable when it comes to the menu and super friendly . When you come in here you immediately feel like family. I have always gone to their other location but from now I'm coming here it's down the street from my house and super convenient . Ribs and brisket are amazing and the sweet corn basket u must get !!   Thank you for the great hospitality ! I will be seeing you very soon !!

Qt_liclYLocg-E76AzG4pA.text: Second time to this location. Sadly, I have to say, it is better than the first location. Not that that location was bad, this is just better in my opinion.   The service is great, so friendly it's almost too friendly, but not. Rather it's just right. Food is quick to get after ordering. Sweet tea is great, not gag you sweet but reminds me of the little restaurant I used to love the tea at back in Goose Creek, SC. Anyways.   The food is tasty. I am a huge brisket fan and this place makes me happy just because of that. Spare ribs are cooked nicely, pulls right off the bone. Yams remind me of Thanksgiving with my family (and all the times I make them for myself while waiting for next year.)  I am about to try the baby back ribs.....they look awesome. If I remember I shall be back to tell the tale.   This place has food you will appreciate and service you will enjoy.

ASXG2ln4Tw7J83JGwI37EA.text: We finally tried Rollin' Smoke! I wanted to try the original years ago on Highland drive but never got around to it. Friends recommended this location and said they had all you can eat last time and it was pretty good. I'm from the Carolinas and grew up on vinegar BBQ, Sweet red BBQ and down in Georgia with my dad mustard BBQ. I was anxious to try their collards and BBQ. We all opted for the AYCE BBQ. Unfortunately I could only eat one platter and one dessert. So $34.95 was a bit too expensive for me just to eat one platter. Next time I would prefer to try 1-2 meats with 3 sides. I love my BBQ but I LOVE my sides! I was pleasantly surprised that they have several sauces that you can try and put as much or as little as you want. The Carolina vinegar sauce was great! The Sweet Mama was my 2nd fave! The mustard one was very good, it was called sweet girl or something. It was a tiny bit sweet with a nice mustard taste. The Arkansas was just okay for me and I didn't go anywhere near the spicy after seeing our friends reaction!  So with the AYCE you order 3 meats and two sides. I tried the baby back ribs, beef ribs and the pulled pork with a side of collards and sweet corn bread. The baby backs were tender and very tasteful. I really liked them with the Sweet Mama sauce! The pulled pork was tender and was great within the Carolina Vinegar BBQ sauce. Now this was the very first time I've had great beef ribs! They were well charred outside and very tender and tasty on the inside. They're also HUGE!!! Like Flinstone RIBS! My friend had the collards the first time they went and she said they were too salty so I decided to try and see if they again. They weren't and even she tried them and said they were better this time around. They were good but still not my daddy's collards.  the sweet cornbread was very delish! The sweet tea was not my cup of tea. We only do Luzianne back home and here was Lipton. Now I tasted several sides from everyone else like the hush puppies which were great! I love hush puppies! Also the green beans, peppery but crisp and fresh. The creamy homemade macaroni and cheese is seasoned and topped. Very different but very good. The homemade banana pudding was on POINT! It was very very good!

Tt-1ODRkETWWkbwQg6v5NA.text: Came in to grab something quick for dinner.  The staff is nice and knowledgeable, the service is fast and the food is good.  The Spudtastics (loaded potatoes) are my favorite item.

wL41_Fbib7frGI4-93vhZA.text: The food was expensive. I paid $18 for a meal and a drink. The ribs weren't that great, but I liked the brisket. This location is really small and kind of hard to navigate with how close they stick the tables together, especially when you have the drinks, condiments, and cutlery shoved in the same little corner as the trash can and everyone is trying to get in there at once.   My brisket tasted good. My friend wasn't a fan of the meatloaf. I got horrifically ill for the rest of the night after I left. The only thing with allergen information on the menu said that the meatloaf was not gluten free, so that kind of makes you assume everything else is gluten free, right? I had never had any kind of reaction to barbeque before. Idk what was going on with my meal, but I was in agony for a good 5-6 hours after eating here.

7qrLDQwJIB4qsGw1bg4VwA.text: The food here is the best! My favorite is the brisket. Their always so friendly. When your dining in they bring the food right to you. Definitely Recommend

1OpzkoNooiebC8noQOkYvA.text: This is a hole-in-the-wall outside facade but buzzing with excitement inside. The Travel Channel touts the smoked meatloaf, but plenty of options.  I choose the 3 meat option: beef rib, brisket and pulled pork.   Corn bread was divine as it was moist and delicious.   Beer available to wash down this deliciousness, although I stayed with water.  A grip of hard sell on the Yelp review for a free desert but free is free - so do some work for a change.   This is bar none the BBQ in town!

aQ9vc4CwXcym0xO2KSbAaA.text: After passing this place for months and with the fact that I just wanted some simple bbque and decided to give it a try... Ordered a triple meat meal with ribs, brisket and pulled pork, sides ordered were potato chip fries and Mac and cheese and loaded mashed potatoes ... We had it delivered and normally we don't expect perfection on delivery because it's never spot on . We asked for sides of all sauces so we could try all to find the ones we liked for future reference.  Ok so... Ribs were fall off the bone delicious and did not need any additional sauce (which was good because the sauces were runny and more of a dressing then a thick slather of deliciousness) We honestly could not tell the difference between the pulled pork and the brisket and so didn't know if we even got one or the other or both... it was blah.  The sides .... how do you describe something with no taste? I don't want to be mean... but the Mac n cheese was like mushy noodles and no taste, the loaded mashed potatoes were hard and almost as if they had been left out all day and quickly reheated.  We did LOVE their potato fries.  So what I learned from this meal was... Yes I will go back and get the ribs (they were a little fatty but very very tender) and the "fries"  We might try a couple other items but we will make sure we have our own bbque sauce on hand.  So. If your in a craving for good ribs then it's a quick spot for a fast meal.

2Th1XGj5UPiHJRcEZjl-Eg.text: Catfish flaky and crunchy, greens have the best flavor because of brisket. Nice people too.

JywQpT4h85vA9ZfIQ6NNag.text: When I parked in front of this place and got out; my mouth started watering.  The smell was so good that it was making me more hungry.  Walking into this place, I noticed it was rather small for a LV restaurant but packed.  It has an authentic genuine bbq joint look to it.  You walk up to the cash registers to place your order.  If your eating in they will bring the food to you.  If your taking food to go they will call your name.  To the right of the cashiers, there is all their bbq sauces available to taste.  They have a good variety too.  Anything from mustard based to vinegar.  I tried all of them and they were delicious.  All of them do have a little bite to them and the "damn hot" is not for the timid.  As busy as this place was, my order was out in less than 10 min.  I got The Biggin.  On the menu its a hot link with pulled pork ans brisket.  I got it with a hot dog instead of the link.  This thing was huge and its flavor matched it size.  I will definitely order this again and it will make it hard for me to try new things.  The meat was tender, moist, and flavorful.  Which for brisket is extremely hard to do, but I was impressed.  I also got a side of mac and cheese , which didn't have much flavor, but was delicious with some bbq sauce.  Honestly you could easily dive past this place on a daily basis and not know it was there, but its definitely worth the effort.  I know I'm going back to try out more dishes.

PzB_Sbk6RtGyOL4PIDWR4w.text: Best BBQ food I've had outside of Kansas!! We ordered a 5 meat plate with 3 sides and it was AMAZING. The flavor of the meat was outstanding and so so tender. I didn't expect to much from the sides, but they were just as good as the meat. We will definitely be back!!

1-4df-jmmvOSEBoPs6dKdA.text: If you have not been here please come! The beef ribs are unreal. There is a reason why Rollin smokes is inside t-mobile arena! Best food, staff and environment. Mama sweet is perfection. And if you go please try the corn bread.

00fJWEYOfnKZJ0a1NlKSAQ.text: Delish!  Love a dinner where teenagers, parents and grandparents are all happy!  We ordered a 2-meat combos (1/2 lb total of pulled pork and pulled chicken) for $22 that came with a side and drink, basically the drink was free with this combo.  Ala carte meat is 1/4 lb for $8, we added this to the combo and the kids split it.  Meat was tender. Moist and good portions.  Serve yourself bbq sauce choices at the register too.  For sides we had Mac and cheese, potato salad and a sweet potato, all good, around $5-$6 each, all can be shared by 2-people IMO.  The location is near downtown Las Vegas and part of a colorful complex with other businesses; bright orange, red, purple painted building with its own small lot.  Not a lot of seating but 6 of us sat together at the center table.    Good food at a good price, hit the spot.  Thanks!

ym92P1zn0eYkpsjmcRm_CQ.text: I would give this restaurant 10 stars based on their food! Best BBQ I have yet to have in Vegas. The restaurant is clean, the staff is friendly, the decor is fitting and, as I said the food is great! (I had the St. Louis style ribs, waffle fry's and Cole slaw) Now..why 4 instead of 5 stars? This appears to have been a take-out place that grew into a restaurant. My only complaint (and the reason for 4 stars instead of 5) is the fact that you eat from Styrofoam containers with  flimsy plastic utensils and packets (instead of bottles) for the ketchup. C'mon guys...make your mind up. Are you a take-out joint or a sit down restaurant? If the latter, start acting like it.

WKuIwkaqihypbioS5Y3Aew.text: Rolling Smoke BBQ for the first time today! Now I've heard from people that this is the best bbq in town, and others who have said they are not impressed. I can say without a doubt this is amazing food! Big ups to Big Mike for steering me towards the brisket burnt ends even though they are an extra $3.00 on the combo plate. Pay it! These had me making yummy noises with every bite. I ate at the new SW location, so I don't know how it compares to downtown. I might never know as this is so close to work.

NvYGr15eGMZgsGUVU3KqAA.text: This place was great! We went to the location a little off the strip to avoid crowds etc. We got there a little after they opened so we had the place to ourselves. Melissa at the cash register gave us lots of options depending on what were looking for and we just got one of their specials to share. Price was fantastic! We got alot of food for only $35.00. 5 choice of meats and 3 sides was plenty. Also I love that their cups are reusable and if you bring it back you get $1.00 off. Unfortunately I'm a Cali girl and don't come to Vegas too often. Anywho I would highly recommend if your in the area.

jmuH2O5K0JvzRpVerFEDJg.text: Literally the best bbq I've ever had! Everything fell off the bone and was tender. Glad we ordered enough for leftovers for daysss

v5_sFc_VXy5wPI60tZlWnw.text: When opening the doors going in Rollin smoke barbecue you can smell barbecue getting your taste buds ready. But our experience with downhill from there. Remember to try the original not the sequel. The management and the rest of the staff seemed none caring and dismissive. Extremely poor service. The ribs were overpriced. We were getting our food to go and I asked about the different sauces that rolling smoke barbecue had. The cashier wasn't friendly and just rolled her eyes at me said "oh your sauces are in your bag." We just wanted to experience what different sauces they had and what made them so special. I love a good bbq spot the I ordered two meat combo brisket and chicken mac and cheese. Bottom of my list of BBQ places. I was very uncomfortable and the girl who took our order brought my whole mood down. . If you want average BBQ, and give your money to a owner that has a bad attitude, rude and really shouldn't own a restaurant. Come here. If you want good barbecue go to the original Rollin Smoke BBQ or Bell's BBQ in Seven Hills.

Q_HEXs868fnyGwt4BKGZpw.text: This is our 1st time going there, my wife wanted to take me because she knows I love good bar b q.  We ordered the sampler to get a taste of everything. Our sides were baked beans and Mac and cheese. By the way no military discount on the sampler. The Mac and cheese was ok, had green peppers in it, a little out of the ordinary for me. The beans were kidney beans mixed with meat sauce. The corn bread was great by me. The ribs were  nothing to write home about, they did fall off the  bone. Would I go back? I don't think so.

hGvyHUjOERHrLQu9_kKx_g.text: We went mid afternoon on  a Friday, a line as usual, but it moved fast!!  We hit it right, the fare was excellent.  We tried the "brisket 3 ways," our nomination for the best thing on the menu.  Good choice of sauces and the brisket was tops.  I watched one gent go for the special: all you can eat for $36.  You don't have to stand back in line for refills, just stop any staff member.  All you want of anything.  And you have 1 hour.  It is a fun place with friendly staff, great people watching and most of all the best barbecue in town.

LlvzyduB--AGtATnbhe94Q.text: My roommate and I have been here twice now, and we've been super impressed! The first time we went we got the five meat sampler which includes ribs, brisket, chicken, pulled pork and hot links! My favorites were the chicken and pulled pork, while my roommate preferred the brisket and ribs.   As for sides we got mashed potatoes, mac and cheese, yams and added cornbread! My roommate had nothing but good things to say about the yams and I loved their mac n cheese!  Best of all is their service. The employees are all awesome and make the experience a great one (it's just one of the reasons we decided to come back!)

RdObTT6CyRgaac8T-4DchQ.text: Service was great as I called with questions and spoke to the manager who was very friendly.  Food was ok.  Prices for what you get are way high. KbOSvaWxZN1dgmJwxzQuUg.text: Excellent!  The best Carolina bbq sauce we have found locally. The food was cooked to perfection!  Great prices and fast.

GXAAjSd0PQX06ayCZ4A0Lg.text: We heard some terrific things about Rollin Smoke Barbecue and felt it was time to give it a try. We originally went to the location just east of the strip. Unfortunately it was closed on Sundays. However this location is open on Sundays. You walk up to the counter to order. When your food is ready they bring it to the table. The women behind the counter were incredibly friendly and helpful. While it is not really table service per se, the service they provided was excellent. My wife and I decided to share the st. Louis ribs and a side of waffle fries. Wow was that good!! These had to be the meatiest ribs I have ever had. And waffle fries were perfectly prepared. We loved it all. Despite coming in pretty hungry, we had difficulty finishing the meal. My son-in-law and his son both have much bigger appetites than I have. They went with the all-you-can-eat special for $35. If you have a big appetite this is a great deal. They ordered three or four different Meats. Each one was excellent. This is not as upscale as Lucille's or Famous Dave's, but the ribs are much better. I will definitely be coming back.

GxobtgvP431m-u5GDGj60A.text: This is a cute little BBQ joint! I highly enjoyed the BBQ chicken!! And Nary was an amazing hostess, fun and  bubbly and she kept a smile on her face during the dinner rush!

5QW50fDeHYMi4TjQG8J90Q.text: This place truly deserves 100 stars! My whole family took bites of each others plates and everything was absolutely incredible! This is the BEST barbecue i have ever had. The employees are extremely friendly and the environment is excellent. I cant describe in words how amazing this food is!!

s_HiVqOfC45F_SQ-5WM0wg.text: Fast friendly service with a smile!  Best brisket I have ever had!  Waffle fries are a little Cajun spicy for me but very tasty!  Another pleasant experience while traveling for business!  Definitely worth the trip!

FcyWeYK4utEq0yldK2kcXQ.text: After dealing with the hiccups of mixed up links and phone numbers, I finally got ahold of the location on Grand Canyon. Unfortunately, Google says that this location is open until 10pm. So, unknowingly at like 7:55pm, I called to see if I could place an order for pickup. After a brief hold I was asked what we wanted to order. With screaming kids in the background and having to relay my cc # multiple times, paying over the phone was unsuccessful, so it was agreed to pay upon my arrival. Well, when I got there the store was pretty much dark. All of the tables were stacked with chairs, the place was spotless and three quite pleasant ladies were behind the counter with my order ready to go. I felt SO guilty that this team stayed well over closing time to provide EXCELLENT customer service! They could've easily told me over the phone that they were already closed. Well, it was worth the drive across town to pick it up! And as always, the food was excellent. Thank you so much for everything that you provide; the service, quality, and consistency is always top notch! This is why we come back time and time again.

A41aKrA5NwHAMkE01iPKSw.text: Every time we come here, it's magical. From how amazing the quality of the meat is to how kind the staff is, this has quickly become one of our favorites. The meat is so tender and juicy! All of it! I told my husband that I don't understand how this level of amazingness is even achieved with meat, haha. And the owner/manager is SO so so so nice! He gave us a couple of free desserts because he didn't realize he didn't have enough crinkle cut fries when we ordered them, and he got his daughter to go get more back up fries and bring it back to the restaurant just to make us some. He is always so friendly and generous. Just like a business should be run! We love you!!! Can't wait to come back.

tLm6c2nKrv4rZiv3-dBMaw.text: Rollin' Smoke BBQ.... what a joy in my mouth!   I have been to rolling smoke a few times and its been nothing but greatness. Ill start with the obvious, the food is out of the world delicious. Food melts in your mouth and is probably some of the most tender meat i have ever had. They have a wide variety of flavors for the sauce you can put on the meat you order. The original is great but they also have some that will have some kick to it (spicy).   So I was a bit shocked when I first stopped by here. I ordered the next size up from the original portion they give you. HOLY SMOKES..... I can eat a TON and this was a portion size I couldn't handle.. Unreal!!! Whats crazy is.. they have another portion size bigger than the one I couldn't finish! I cant even imagine someone eating that, its gotta be for a family of 10 or something lol.   Both locations are great, the one near the strip is probably a bit more authentic and raw. I would definitely swing by all three locations if your in those areas and of course hungry.   Staff is always nice and make it a wonderful experience. If you're not familiar with the menu, they are more than willing to help pick out something amazing for you to enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dXyPe1XLc73FTRkfCB3ugw.text: BBQ places with brisket are hard to find, especially with actually GOOD brisket. After driving by this place picking up my SO from work, we decided to go check it out. (It doesn't help you can smell the BBQ driving by sometimes.)   The first time we came here, we got the meat sampler to give all their meats a try. It comes with ribs, brisket, BBQ chicken, pulled pork, and a hotlink. Even though I came here for brisket, my favorite meat they had were the ribs. They were fat and tender with a nice flavor. It almost melts in your mouth. This isn't a knock against the brisket! The brisket was good, it's just that the brisket that came with the meal was finely chopped rather than whole slices. It's not my preferred way to have brisket, but it was tasty on the brisket sandwich I got the next time I came. The other meats were great too, especially the chicken which was nice and moist.   The worst part of this BBQ joint is their sides, for the most part, they're just kind of... bland? Of their sides, I've had the potato salad, collard greens, mac and cheese, and loaded mash potatoes. With all the bacon and cheese they add to the sides, it's strange that they don't have much flavor to them. The best one was the mac and cheese, but even that one wasn't one to write home about.  There's a good amount of parking around the area and there's a good amount of seating, though it is likely to get crowded quickly around lunch and dinner.   I still want to check out other BBQ places, but this one will be my goto unless I find something better.

x84YWpQTT_Jnwhl7mDZDlg.text: My mouth is watering thinking about this all over again.  My family & I ventured to Rollin' Smoke BBQ for a celebratory night out. It was definitely a treat. We opted for the BBQ Sampler. It certainly did not disappoint. With over 2 pounds of meat and 4 large sides - we were all left with more than we could chew.  The BBQ Sampler included:  1 whole chicken - better than I expected. I have to be honest & say I am not necessarily a fan of BBQ chicken. However, if I had to eat it, I'd want it from Rollin' Smoke.  1/2 lb Brisket - who doesn't love brisket? It is the king of BBQ, if you ask me. I wish it was sliced instead of chopped, but, it was delicious nonetheless.  1/2 lb Pulled Pork - very tasty. Having overcooked pulled pork is pretty common, but Rollin' Smoke has got it right with pulled pork cooked perfectly.  1/2 lb hot links - perhaps the most popular at our family dinner table. We loved the hot links!  The BBQ sampler also featured four large sides. We chose mac & cheese, loaded mashed potatoes, BBQ beans, and fried okra. The loaded mash was my hands down favorite. The other sides were just up to par for me.  $80 may sound like a lot...but guys, this was A LOT of food. We all had leftovers for the next day. I may or may not be planning my next visit at this exact moment...

9qERYdbPxO2K6VAa6fpYzg.text: I've ordered from this place via postmates at least 10 times and have been inside to eat once, and let me say this barbecue is to die for! I usually always get the burnt ends and the brisket, wow they're good! Everything is well seasoned with lots of sauce where as some barbecue places bring their meat out dry and you add the sauce yourself. The sauce they use is phenomenal and the seasoning is just as good! The meat comes on top of toasted bread that soaks up all those delicious juices. They're cornbread is next level, perfectly sweet and moist. I've also there's their "Mama's Banana Puddin" and it was soo good with big fresh chunks of banana. C8mtK6UuXGWNVtqX1bp_qQ.text: My boyfriend and I decided to stop into Rollin' Smoke BBQ on a Saturday morning, 11:00 A.M. This restaurant is off of the 215/Flamingo, in a large shopping plaza. There is plenty of parking nearby the restaurant for any-time of the day.  Inside the restaurant, all of the tables were clean and spotless. There menu consists of a variety of BBQ items, like pulled pork, chicken, spare ribs, sides [mac n cheese, corn bread, beans etc.].  We decided to do the 5 meat , 3 side special for $27.00 ~. The 5 meats we selected were the following  -Hot Links, -BBQ Spare Ribs -BBQ Chicken -BBQ Pulled Pork -BBQ Brisket. -Mac N Cheese -Corn Bread -BBQ Beans  The meal came out immediately. I had gone to the restroom and came out, the meal was at the table. Quite quick, but the quality of the food was quite lackluster.  The BBQ Spare Ribs were too fatty to eat. There was barely on meat on it. The Brisket, was shredded, with too much peppercorn added to the meat. All I could taste was the Peppercorn. The Pulled Pork had a little to much Peppercorn as well. I didn't eat the Hot Links, so I can't comment on that meat, but the only meat I truly enjoyed was the BBQ Chicken. I would get the BBQ chicken again.   I would select different sides to try if I came back to this BBQ restaurant again. The Corn Bread was a little too soggy for my taste profile. The Mac N Cheese was good. It used large elbow noodles and there was plenty of spices/cheese used in the dish. The BBQ beans were okay, mixed with a few different meats and heavily sauced with BBQ.  This BBQ is just okay. If I came back here, I would just get their BBQ Chicken and try out different sides.

94TQL_Mwvbr4dibhfGb8FA.text: I have been going to Rollin Smoke for at least 4 years now. About year or so ago they opened a location in Summerlin, which was way closer to my house. The food was what you would expect from Rollin Smoke. I have thought they were the best BBQ in Vegas. Now after two disappointing deliveries from door Dash on a two meat combo, they lost my business. A two meat combo at $13.99 with literally two slices of brisket, and one side with dried out ribs  is not worth it in my opinion!

DEbdigOYRveJst6lxTFV1Q.text: Wow and wow,  what a awesome place. Its been some time since I been to Rollin' Smoke BBQ and like always they don't disappoint. The meat just falls off the bone so juicy and tender. It was prepared exceptionally. Whatever you order it will melt in your mouth and you will get addicted to the flavors. 9cEKhvxcIERBpGuYAvWgLw.text: Always been a fan of Rollin Smoke BBQ since the original location. I know this second location been open for sometime now. I never gotten around to it. I was in the mood for some BBQ recently so figure now good time.   Whenever talk about multiple locations first thing comes to my mind is consistency. Rollin Smoke BBQ this second location had exactly the same memories from the original. The portion size are awesome "HUGE". My first visit went with the "Big Hawk" pulled pork sandwich. Talk about overflow. OMG. The amount of pork is two or three times more then bread. I was good either way killing it with fork or straight sandwich. The pork was amazing. Moist, juicy, and divine. Mac and cheese was solid.  Second visit went with the chopped brisket sandwich. Again overflow of meat. Tasty. Not sure if can put one sandwich better then the other. Both hell of addicting!  I had cornbread for my side. Da bomb. It one of the best cornbread had in Vegas. Moist, not dense, fluffy, hot, golden crust, and perfect.   The only difference with second location. It is in much nicer neighborhood with lots of parking and more modern. The personality is still the same with the interior decor. The different sauces with the names....love it. Service five stars all around. If looking for some good BBQ need make stop at Rollin Smoke BBQ.

The Mac and cheese was different but oh so cheesy good. The burnt ends were delicious. I also ordered a sweet tea and banana pudding. Both were exactly what I was looking for. vsgAfhg3Z-p9tixV_waeYQ.text: Rollin' Smoke BBQ was the first BBQ place I ate in Vegas. My first experience was very good, from what I remember. This time around.... to be brutally honest it, was weak af. (Scroll to the bottom for short review)  Long review: I ordered the pit special. Comes with: Brisket, chicken, hot link, ribs, and chicken (again?). It also comes with three sides. I chose fries, Mac & cheese, and loaded mash potatoes.   Alright let's get this review out of the way... The platter felt like it was just sitting out in the back, under a heat lamp. The meats were not even warm, felt more like room temperature. To provide a better example, the cheese on my loaded mash potatoes were not melting. They were perfectly fine, just chilling there not melted.   As for the cooking of the meats, the brisket was meh. It was finely shredded to teeny tiny bits, that my fork can't hold. Either they dice the brisket in a blender, or Edward Scissor Hands was in the back going hard. It was decently seasoned, but nothing crazy.  As for the chicken... dry. Seasoned in desert sand and cooked under the Nevada heat. Just kidding, but all jokes aside, the chicken was terrible. I definitely don't recommend ordering the chicken. If I wanted dry chicken, I could have easily made it myself.   Hotlinks were the best thing on the platter. Good spice, and flavor. The ribs were decent, but again nothing you can't make at home.   Short review:  Not worth the money. Felt like the food was left in the back and then served when ordered. Chicken was super duper trash. Brisket was ran through a paper shredder. Not sure how they won awards for their bbq. Jessie Rae's BBQ is a lot better!!

Es7dDGZqn2cR4dQrjfie-w.text: I was happy that a Rollin Smoke opened up near my place since the first location was a bit bit of the way for me. I have been here a couple of times and tried different items. I have tried their meatloaf more than once . The first time I gave it a try because it's what they are known for. The second time was because I did enjoy it even though I don't normally eat meatloaf.  It's a little different than your typical meatloaf because it's spicy. My husband usually gets their burger which is huge. You would need to cut it up in order to eat it. He really liked it ! I love the banana pudding here so much that that's the only dessert I like to order. To be honest I haven't tried the other desserts.  I think the space is a little small especially if it gets busy but I was always able to find a seat. I think it's because the service is fast and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana pudding
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The meatloaf
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3Fsuis4ZgQqXkl2PMzzWGQ.text: Smoked Meatloaf Will Fill Your Belly  This is the first visit to this location . I went to the Original location on Highland Drive about 2 years ago . I'm usually not in this area so I decided to stop and get the Smoked Meatloaf that everyone raves about and was on the Travel Channel .   I have to say be hungry . I ate half and put the rest in refrigerator for tomorrow . It is thick cut on top of loaded mashed potatoes and topped with onion straws and Mama's Sweet Delicious Sauce . It was good , but I will probably get the 3 meat plate next time . They have 6 sauces which I got 2 others to try . Mama's is the right choice for the meatloaf .   There are lots of choices in Vegas for BBQ and I think Rollin Smoke is just average , that is why I never went back to the other location . I remember I got pulled pork and some other stuff with my son and he wasn't impressed either . So we go back to other favorites . I love BBQ and try different types and meats .   I do have to say it is better than the Billy's BBQ that was there before even though they gave you a good devil egg and good coleslaw .

vtJdx02XEfDsaO6IKTuHlw.text: I have enjoyed eating at the Highland St. location several times and been wanting to try the Smoked Meatloaf. This location is closer to home and I finally made it. Today I was doing take out. Place your order at the counter and they will call you when it is ready. The meatloaf order is a complete dinner. A generous portion of meat sitting on top of a mound of mashed potatoes and all of that covered with crispy onion strings. On the side was 3 containers of Mamas Sweet Delicious sauce, 2 pickles and a roll. The meatloaf was tender inside with a nice crispy crust. Add some sauce and its juicy. The potatoes were creamy and the pickles crisp. The roll was nothing special just soft and fresh.  Now I have another decision as what to order, it's all delicious. My favorite BBQ in Las Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked Meatloaf

1iNSlaInYvn-uGWFll-FrQ.text: To find this level of quality BBQ in Summerland of all places leaves me both dumbfounded and very thankful.  And any irrational or unwarranted fears I may have had about a possible drop off in BBQ goodness from the original Rollin' Smoke BBQ to this one has been quite dispelled - it's seriously just as tasty.  Spare ribs were tender and juicy with just the right amount of flavorful fat.  The brisket was equally tender and nicely seasoned.  And the only real question to date is which BBQ sauce and sides I prefer, and I think that answer may vary from one protein to another - to which I may have to dedicate a whole review to later.  But the best part for yours truly is their Summerland location is way closer to my neck of the woods and a lot more freeway accessible than the one near The Strip with a ton of parking.  There's plenty of seating if I can't wait to bring BBQ back home and need to start devouring it right then and there.  Overall, I'll be back to try the other kind of ribs, the chicken, the hot link, etc, etc, etc.

20b8chYGlyMTQMRYog-vqQ.text: Saturday July 7th 2018 7:37 PM  We've ate at Rollin' Smoke at Las Vegas Motor Speedway before and it's usually finger lickin' good. We were watching the Daytona Monster Energy series race when we had a cravin' for Barbecue.  I went with the 2 brisket sliders and a Mac & cheese with a sweet tea (kids menu).   My brisket was salty and lacked flavor for a place that rubs their meats.  The Mac & cheese was also salty and watery.  Their beverage options were soda or tea.  I went with tea but was disappointed that it was Lipton tea and I'm not a fan of them but I won't fill up on soda.  Boyfriend said his ribs were not great, he said some were cold & dry and his meal was $25.  Not impressed with the food, but they have a locals discount for anyone who does like comin' here.

yViyKk5Xr0nr-DU9C28oTw.text: Really good, solid barbeque. I come here when I'm feeling a little homesick, since it's the closest thing I've ever found to my parents' barbeque (which is no meager compliment!). I thoroughly enjoy their pulled pork, but their brisket is excellent as well, either in a sandwich or as an entree. I suggest the potato salad as a side, but their waffle fries are tasty too; always crispy with a little salty/sweet/spicy seasoning. The staff are always fantastic. Really personable guys and gals who are invested in giving you a nice, laid-back dining experience. The dining room is a bit small, as some previous reviewers have pointed out, but there are plenty of tables (without making you feel smashed in like sardines), and I've never had an issue finding seating. This is a favorite place. We always end up coming here at least once when my family is in town, and if I have friends from out of state I'll invite them out with a "Do you like barbeque? Because I know a really good place..." So I get good company and good food; It's a win/win situation for me :)

ce8V8KNkfcYLJLEttEa3IQ.text: My favorite thing to get is the Spudtastic with pulled pork OMG it is beyond amazing. I'm a huge fan of loaded potatoes or loaded fries and theirs is so good. Their Mac and cheese is also great! I'm so stuck on the Spudtastic I haven't tried anything else yet but I plan to in the future!

ITLefntg9BFsnVLgZGnoYQ.text: I don't even know where to start as far as satisfaction. We live in the northwest and come on this side of town very seldom. We decided to try the Rollin Smoke BBQ we we had tried it at a few events around town and WOW. The food was spectacular, the place is very well kept and clean. They have adorable decor representing the bbq theme, Vegas knights, AND Vegas strong representation of our town... I just loved it all! Lastly the staff is SO warming, welcoming, and assure that you have every last thing you could need while eating. Our family will definitely be making the drive to enjoy this fantastic experience again.

qL3FfxVqWbHEQxthuI0dyg.text: bbq. Was Awsome had the pit special split it with 3 people plus side rib tips and hushpuppies and staff was exceptional whould co.e back next time in town

PuJ25ugAPyF2B4ISDav07Q.text: I absolutely love this place. The staff was insanely friendly and polite, plus the BBQ is some of the best I've had in the valley. This is absolutely a must go place for food!  First, when you walk in you are overwhelmed by the delicious scent of properly made BBQ. The staff greets you quickly and with a genuine smile on their face. They'll offer suggestions if you need it or space if you simply need to review their rather large menu. It should be noted that while the are not the cheapest joint I think their prices are well justified by the quality and quantity of food. I personally had the roasted chicken and the sliced brisket with a side of waffle fries. The chicken was moist and well seasoned while the brisket literally fell apart when trying to pick it up with a fork. All of their rubs were delicious. They even season the waffle fries, which were perfect. I highly recommend their "Arkansauce" as it was by far my favorite.   And you cannot I repeat cannot skip dessert. I had the berry cobbler with ice cream of course, and it did not disappoint! Tart and sweet with warm cake and cool vanilla ice cream. It was a pair made in heaven.

F8sy7Atm_5CXbwEfH4MpWA.text: Hit or miss! When they are on it's the best BBQ in town but someone needs to do some quality control because I have had a bone in 2 of my 10 or so orders and I didn't order ribs (:  I was first introduced to them at a home opening in Inspirada and am happy that they opened another location off the strip. This location used to be a different BBQ place that was good also. Good food costs a little and this place is a tad pricey, but worth it.

YFeHfOmkGH5uEqojPPitUQ.text: TERRIBLE! Service and food! Save your money! We ordered the Five meat platter, and a rib sampler. Spent (wasted) $65..All food was cold. Mac and cheese served with cold prepackaged shredded cheese on top. Small dining area, can't back up chair without bumping the person behind you.  Arrived at 7:50p, took our order, but failed to tell us they close at 8p! (Website states 10pm) they were pre closing around us, made us feel rushed. As we walked out, a couple was walking in, said they wanted to try it. Thank goodness we caught them in time! Advised them to NOT even bother! Go elsewhere...

T_EHQb0oTxqD9VjTGRwzOw.text: The food is truly amazing but they aren't True with their weights. We normally dine in but today we decided to do carry out. We ordered the BBQ sandwich pack. We were able to substitute our 1/2 gallon of any one side for four individual sides. When we got home with our food my wife weighed the food because she thought there wasn't 3lbs of hot links, brisket, and pulled pork. The weight was 2 lbs 3 oz. we were short almost an entire pound.

nb5_XpOIsF5miRdQmvDqGw.text: The bbq here is the best in Vegas.  But what adds to it is Melissa.  She makes you feel very welcomed along with going the extra mile to make sure you are a satisfied customer.

XYfknuUWgoC5tKIzyc93dg.text: I heard about this place from my nail tech and had been by a few times but never went inside. This Christmas I decided to take a break from cooking like a mad woman so I went into Rolling Smoke to order the meat portion of dinner. From the moment I walked in the door, i was stunned. It smelled AMAZING and the service was impeccable. I was looking for suggestions on how much food I would need for 8-10 people and the chef came out and gave me a rundown on recommendations from the different meats to the sauces. The manager or possibly the owner then had them make me a big ol' plate to take with me to try the meats I ordered for a Christmas Eve pick up free of charge. The plate was huge and the food was off the hook, perfectly seasoned...not dry or too salty. I am so excited to pick up my food on Christmas Eve because I know I won't be disappointed. Thank you to the staff at Rolling Smoke, you guys really wowed me and I look forward to eating your delicious food in a couple of weeks! Two thumbs up!

WkK6QvwcbJAbvIbAr1DMyQ.text: Best BBQ in Las Vegas and it's not even close.

nbJAZ0IPHKDHnRO5ZBB8ZA.text: Had the pleasure of eating the best BBQ I've had in years at Rollin Smoke tonight! Believe me, being from Texas that is a some compliment!! The ribs and brisket were to die for, and whatever you do don't miss the deep fried cream corn nuggets!  Noticed the three men in front of me were ordering Smoked Meatloaf that's been featured on Food Network! Looked amazing! It's family owned from Arkansas and they are down home super nice!   Forget the other places in Vegas, you've just read about the best!!! Thanks Mike and Denise! Watch out Texas, you have competition!!   Have returned several times since I posted that last review and there's never been a time I've been disappointed! Excellent BBQ!!

rm4zWxEuxOFaHFx9OkL07A.text: This place never let's me down. Took my fiancee here for the first time and she loved it. Glad they finally open up on the west side of town but now neednto open another in the north west by me. Portions are great for the price.

XBjIV-h8wmWDUJbHQkh9Gw.text: First time eating here. Staff is super friendly definite thumbs up there. The menu is huge took a minute to decide on something. When I did I went with the duo plate. I got brisket and ribs while my girlfriend got brisket chopped and chicken. For our sides we got BBQ beans, Mac and cheese, and yams. While the brisket was tender as well as all the meat, the flavor wasn't anything special, we were pretty disappointed. Now the sides however were really good. We liked the Mac and cheese a lot as well as the yams. The beans were a little different but still pretty tasty. Lastly the sauce. I mean what is BBQ without the sauce. They gave us a few different sauces so that we can try them and honestly they weren't all that. We ended up pulling some sweet baby rays out of the fridge. May come back to try the desserts but that's it.

Fgb-uS8HLcco5MLHQgpWmg.text: I had been there twice before, the first time was great. The second time was ok. This time food and customer service was awful. We had ordered the baby back ribs. I don't think they were smoked long enough. They don't really deserve any stars.

I should have known this place wasn't any good as soon as I saw "all you can eat, everything on the menu." Our order was to go, food came out very fast. I asked the worker for extra BBQ sauce she said there was some already in the bag we got home and there was no extra sauce. That made me a little mad but whatever I was pumped up to eat some ribs. My wife says her chicken sandwich is really dry, my ribs were ok but really salty, the brisket was ok and the chicken I order was just ok. For the price I think I'd rather go somewhere else. I don't plan on come back here.

zvRIXOgUZ5xZIbhublHMjw.text: Wow, this place, the food was amazing.  The meat quality was excellent and their workers were friendly and attentive.  If you are in a mood for good BBQ, I highly recommend this place.

Rcnwc-TSRWczMSEuyAwtFA.text: Staff was very helpful putting together a meal that I really wanted. Very friendly. Chef Ty can really cook up some barbecue! Best barbecue I've had in a long time. I've had it in Memphis, all the way to Texas, and this place really knows their barbecue.  Thanks, Chef Ty, for great barbecue!

VCRDkE6HaFCKPcogKDXD3w.text: Holy smokes BBQ batman!  Had the rib platter n family had other items.  Everyone was blown away on the huge long smoked meats n fell off bone with very little fat.  Wife said best ribs between  San Diego n North Carolina.  Don't let the ghetto interior discourage you... you'll forget it all after the first bite.

z-S_B08DK7PJZni34Cn73w.text: I've gone here several times now since it's opening. Food has been great each time I've gone back. Our cashier Nary, remembered me and my friend since we go there so often. Nary took great care of us and made the experience enjoyable.   My friend got the 2 meats combo with double ribs, while I chose the smoked meatloaf. Everything came out delicious, the ribs were tender and the smoked meatloaf was meaty and savory.   I always recommend Rollin' Smoke to friends and family that want a good bbq experience. I bbq myself and always finding my way back to Rollin' Smoke for their food.

fati5mndyg8ku0mMdpQWaA.text: Hands down BEST BBQ FOOD IN VEGAS. I've done the homework, don't waste your time and money elsewhere.  Favorite menu item: BURNT ENDS  10/10 for flavor  Try it, the original location always has a line out the front door. Loving this new SW location closer to SUMMERLIN.   CHEF TY HAS THE BEST GUEST SERVICE AND FOOD ANYWHERE! He's kind and welcoming! Melissa is always helpful too!

8lixCrptYeuqTkUFg-K_Gw.text: Rollin smoke is so yummy. I have eaten here so many times I feel like part of the family. They are so kind and they can cook their tails off. My goodness what haven't I had!? The meatloaf is amazing and unique. It is a must try. Along with the brisket, catfish, greens, pulled pork, sausages.... what haven't I enjoyed from here? Friendly people; a great atmosphere; wonderful food. There's not much more a patron could ask for.

gTaCf64Nqea4135LdAnEAg.text: Thank you Angie and Melissa for the amazing food and fantastic customer service. This place is the Bomb

0djgHzudI8GQ7snzyh1DpQ.text: I placed an online order to be picked up after work.  When I arrived the order was being completed.  The staff was pleasant and helpful.  The tall guy even helped me take everything to my vehicle.  The food was delicious with no complaints.  I like this restaurant better than the one on Highland due to lack of traffic constraints.

d2VA5y0ILO6FclCbMSV9pg.text: Wow. The BBQ is amazing. We ordered the sliced brisket, the chopped brisket, beef short ribs, chicken, hot links, burnt ends, bacon mashed potatoes, bacon potato salad. This is the best BBQ I've ever had. Flavors are incredible, smokey, meat is tender and perfect. Will come here again and again. Outstanding.

Yx-j6eJEddJb80F7BujfPg.text: I was very impressed by the original location but this one left me a little confused. We ordered the beef rob half slab plate and the outlaw burger. The beef ribs were super dry and the burger was just sloppy. I had expected a lot because there's so many reviews on how that outlaw burger is one of the best in town. Not really in my opinion. I'm going to say the original location puts out better Bbq IMO maybe I came on a bad day or the chefs here don't know what they're doing whatever the reason I would rather not come back. This is a way better location and it's brand new but if they don't start keeping the reputation of this place strong just like the last Bbq spot that was here it will get shut down. I spent almost $50 for something I could've got way better at a chain Bbq spot. I'm sorry for the harsh words but it's True.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Poe5ixG5tph_3rsRyokQDA.text: Pretty good, not great, and a bit pricey in my opinion. The Rib Platter Special is 3 Babyback ribs, 2 St. Louis Spare Ribs, and 1 Beef Rib for $24.99. The Beef Rib was by far my favorite. The Smoked Meatloaf is a dish that was featured on the Travel Channel according to their menu. It is loaded mashed potatoes topped with a piece of Meatloaf, lots of barbecue sauce and topped with fried onion rings for $15.99. I did not like the barbecue sauce on top of this, for me I wish I had ordered the sauce on the side, it really messed up the whole thing for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rib platter and smoked meatloaf

EsQOMADXsUu_aA9PdJL48Q.text: We had the D's Delicious Sampler and the burnt ends.  The burnt ends were spectacular but a little spicy.

ZX9KDb-o2oAXO_HelH3h6A.text: We got the meat sampler, the sausage was very good. Everything was better than the average bbq joints. We are not from the area, so we found this by the ratings, but we would return if we were in the area.

AE7kHPdd_ZbgfAKVTOqFsA.text: I really want to rate this place higher but just cant. Its a little funky, kind of big portion BBQ with a bit of a twist on some of the dishes.  I have been here twice now and both times in my opinion the pork was overcooked and dry.  That's a killer in my BBQ book.    The menu is really interesting , I want to try the big burger someday. The staff is very nice, I just think the actual BBQ is average at best.

nFLpNS9eWIhIHKpv9wHbYg.text: This place is really good if you like Southern food. We got a ton of stuff to go such as fried catfish, sausage, brisket, corn bread, macaroni and cheese, collared greens, and mashed potatoes. The restaurant when you walk in is really tiny. There are only a few places to sit down and it was definitely packed. We walked in and got our food right away. Everything was super delicious! I wish they had more vegetarian options, but for bbq there usually aren't too many options. I would definitely go here again, but I think the best option would be to go. The service was excellent. The staff was so friendly! Everyone was really positive and kind. I think there are more locations, but this is the closest one in the Summerlin area.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ekaEp8_Bm5PLsHDz8Ewbpg.text: What can I say. I am an absolute barbecue aficionado. I have been grilling and smoking foods since I was a wee little man.  so when I enter this establishment let's just say my standards are pretty high.  the food was absolutely amazing! And the prices weren't bad either. It's rather small on the inside, but it has enough seating for small groups and a TV for watching sports of latest news. The vibe on the interior is very quaint and has a southern appeal with some humor tied in.  I would recommend the beef brisket chopped, the smoked ham, and more beef brisket; :-)  They have a wide array of sauces that cover all pallets everything from sweet to sour to tangy to spicy.  They also do chicken there but I haven't tried it yet. They cater which is good to know.  the staff and the chefs are extremely respectful and genuinely funny. Our food was out in no time at all.  I will definitely be frequenting this establishment on a regular basis as I have a propensity for all things barbecue. But this place... Make no mistake does barbecue right!

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NAr0v0-NKnpMQTfJUc6dCg.text: We came back two more times.  The food isn't the same as their original location.  I don't think we'll be coming back here.  Service is whatever, not friendly whatsoever.  Looks like a hangout spot for the workers to chat.  Tables are dirty and counters for drinks are messy.  Food is always dry and not fresh apparently.  I'll be going else where from now on.

OfHE6hKfDc-ITzfsMxMfVw.text: While I didn't order any BBQ meal, they kinda ruined a grilled cheese sandwich because of carelessness. they seemed to have grilled it with a tub of burnt black grease that made the bread look as if it had mold. That was not appealing. The fully loaded mashed potatoes were good but man...it's pretty greasy and probably clogged a few arteries.  The fries were good as well.   Also...the prices are high. $10 for a kids meal. Not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese sandwich with black grease. Makes it look like mold. Not appealing.
Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kids meal grilled cheese with fries and a side of loaded mashed potatoes.

69RdOy6tPmyF0nFrYCnMJg.text: I never come here because the lines are too long and there is NEVER anywhere to sit. It's unfortunate because the few times I have been able to stop by when I saw open tables I was very happy with it. I would never pick this because of that inconvenience though. I have tried the trio sammich, which is you like pulled pork I can confidently suggest to you. It's really dry at first but I am assuming its because they want you to add the level of sauce you prefer. Their sauce has a high vinegar content and taste which I am a fan of. On the side I got Mac& Cheese, Potato Salad, and Corn Nuggets. I have also tried the brisket trio with sliced, shredded and burnt ends. I can easily reccomend this too although the burnt ends are my favorite and I could go with just those!   All in all, good food but a really inconvenient place to eat. Like I said before, I never plan to eat here it only happens if I am nearby and happen to see an open table.

photos.caption: Photo of Rollin' Smoke BBQ - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The trio sammich with a hint of mac n cheese peepin&#39; in

NhIAsZY67S87LU2FjqAqpw.text: Ordered from this location online. We had a little bit of a mix up because our order was sent to the Southern Highlands location, but a manager called us and took care of it right away so we wouldn't have to refund the card.    The food was very good, I loved that the mac and cheese had a smokey flavor to it. My favorite was the pulled pork, it was delicious! I understand it's BBQ so basically all meat, but the price was a little high for the amount of food. Definitely will be back.
